content:
Hello, friends. I was wondering if there are any newcomers to Category Theory that would be interested in a study group of the book Basic Category Theory by Tom Leinster. The goal would not be to go over the theory, but to solve the exercises in the book and come up with a solution's manual by the end.
I've already got some of the gist of CT by reading "Category Theory for the Sciences" and now I'm trying to tackle more mathy exercises.
If there are people interested, I'll create a topic in the "learning: reading groups" stream.

Davi Sales Barreira said:

Hello, friends. I was wondering if there are any newcomers to Category Theory that would be interested in a study group of the book Basic Category Theory by Tom Leinster. The goal would not be to go over the theory, but to solve the exercises in the book and come up with a solution's manual by the end.
I've already got some of the gist of CT by reading "Category Theory for the Sciences" and now I'm trying to tackle more mathy exercises.
If there are people interested, I'll create a topic in the "learning: reading groups" stream.

Hi! I've just read this message and I like your project, although my background isn't strong. I suppose you've already started solving the exercises. Which chapter of the book are you working on at the moment?
Hey, @Paolo Scarpat. Sorry, just saw your message now. I haven't actually started. Are you still interested?
@Davi Sales Barreira Yes, I'm still interested :smile: I read a few parts of Leinster's book some time ago, but I didn't work seriously on the exercises.
@Paolo Scarpat , have you checked Steve Awodey's book? I'm actually thinking of going with that instead. Cause it covered more ground.
This week is really busy, so I might start next week.
@Davi Sales Barreira Ok, I think we can try :smile:
I'm keen to join, but probably won't be able to until mid-August. Do start without me if you have enough people!
